sentence.idiomatic: This is the new model car that was just released last week by Ford.
Next week he is going to launch his brand new Mandarin language album.
This new service that the bank just came out with has been very well received.
This policy provides a guarantee of medical treatment for low income families.
In order to guarantee the rights of laborers, the government has drafted a new labor law.

word.literal: to not be able to get

sentence.idiomatic: If even personal safety cannot be guaranteed, how can people concentrate on their work?
Having the support of his wife when he was starting out gave him a lot less to worry about.
Good after-sale service can ease customers' concerns.
Buying insurance can eliminate my fears for the future?
Right now is the most opportune time for seeking employment. I hope you don't let it pass you by.
We are waiting for the opportune moment to conduct internal reforms.
When stocks fell to their lowest, he seized the opportunity and bought a large quantity. He made a lot of money.
After the expiration of the contract, your principal can be returned.
During Spring Festival, the mall put on a "buy 200 yuan get 100 yuan" event.
Because an accounting error caused an overcharge, the company will return double the money to its customers.
What one expends will not necessarily be recouped.
If unable to obtain a large return, the investor likely won't invest.
If you don't study hard, later how will you be able to repay your parents?

word.literal: kill two birds with one stone

sentence.idiomatic: He came up with a good way to kill two birds with one stone.

word.literal: kill two birds with one stone

sentence.idiomatic: In summer, going to the library not only enables you to learn things, but also can help you to avoid getting sunstroke. You could say it's a way to kill two birds with one stone.

word.literal: kill two birds with one stone

sentence.idiomatic: This new kind of energy resource not only saves costs but also reduces pollution. It truly does kill two birds with one stone.
Hello? May I ask is this Ms. Chen?
Yes, who's calling?
Hello, my last name is Zhang. I'm from an insurance company. We've just come out with a new kind of health insurance specially designed for women. I'd like to tell you something about it now.
I'm sorry, I don't have time right now.
It only takes two minutes to offer you a lifetime guarantee. I'm telling you, society's modern woman is under a lot of stress. Our insurance can eliminate your fears about the future.
I don't really have anything to fear right now.
Right. So now is the best time for you to prepare for the future. This insurance includes a lot of health care, medical treatment, accidents and emergencies, surgery, and more...
I'm sorry, I'm not interested in this.

I won't keep you long. This insurance returns money to you at the end of the term. In other words, at the completion of the contract you can receive substantial premium, giving you even more return on your investment.
I really have to hang up.

word.literal: kill two birds with one stone

sentence.idiomatic: Ms. Chen, look... you being in such a rush to hang up indicates your job is busy and that you're under a lot of stress in your life. If you're under a lot of stress you're more likely to have health problems, and this insurance is like using interest to buy a guarantee. Savings and insurance: two for the price of one. It's totally a zero-risk investment.
So tell me... what diseases does it cover?

It covers nearly all serious illnesses. Furthermore, it not only insures serious illnesses, but additionally insures serious women's illnesses. One year of insurance is only 3000 RMB, plus you get the interest on it, but the key thing is having insurance. These days everyone says they can't afford to get sick, but as long as you know something about financial management, take care of yourself, and buy yourself some insurance, then isn't the problem totally solved? Look, why don't we set a time to discuss it?
I'll think about it.
OK. Also, Mother's Day is almost here, so I think you could buy some for your mother as well.
I'll consider that.
Thank you, Ms. Chen. If you have any questions, feel free to call me. My number is... hello? Hello?

word.literal: kill two birds with one stone
